content: Hey! Ready to organise with other Massachusetts Locals!
Good morning James! Me too.
Hello!
I'm engaging in my online channels. Also writing postcards and letters (and organizing friends and family to help).
Hey team Massachusetts! I'm just getting involved but not sure how someone in our state can contribute since we will definitely go for Harris/Walz as a state
So many ways to get involved: writing postcards and letters, text banking, phone banking, online engagement, donations...
Here's a great resource for volunteer opportunities: https://www.forwardtogetherhub.net/where-to-get-stuff

This is just a reminder that you can sign up to phone bank, canvass, get trainings  or take other actions at https://events.democrats.org/ in your state or in one of our battleground states (NC, PA, GA, NH, WI, PA, MI, AZ, NV). Volunteers like you make all the difference! We look forward to seeing you at an event soon.
Hellow from Metro-west!
MA Dems organizing to canvas in NH https://www.mobilize.us/massdems/event/636785/

Is there any weekday canvassing in Nashua? Or are they waiting until GOTV for expanding to weekdays. I found that going up on weekdays you get women who are stay at home moms and far more likely to engage, because the husbands are out of the house.
Hi, I will ask the organizer in the Nashua office about this and will post update here

The Nashua NH office is having a DNC watch party on Thursday, which might be a good chance to meet people there and discuss how you can help efforts in the state

https://events.democrats.org/event/664886/
In the meantime, they do host a weekly phone bank on Wednesdays: https://mobilize.us/s/yYsyi8

For anyone in MA looking to have an impact outside of the state, the highest priority effort right now is getting more people signed up for the weekly phone banks. The links are posted all over discord but let me know if you‚Äôd like me to post them here directly. They also just opened up more trainings for text banking if you‚Äôd rather text than call. You can also join one of the many phone banks or canvasses happening every week in New Hampshire. You can find these events by going to events.democrats.org and filter by campaign/organization ‚Äú2024 NH Victory.‚Äù You can also get involved in NH by being a poll observer or voter protection hotline volunteer. I will post links to the related town halls and trainings here, which are all virtual:

https://events.democrats.org/event/639120/

https://events.democrats.org/event/663982/

https://events.democrats.org/event/663773/

If you need anyone to do any postcard/letter writing or mailers, I would love to help! I live in West Roxbury. I want to volunteer but my options are limited since I cannot drive due to my MS, which also caused me to lose hearing in my right ear so I cannot man phones either unfortunately. I have great handwriting lol!

Hi Stacy, the campaign doesn‚Äôt have any sort of postcard or letter writing program directly. They are focused on other forms of voter contact including text messaging. Have you thought about giving that a try? Here‚Äôs a link to the training, you can always sign up and attend and see if it‚Äôs a good fit for you! It seems like a lot of people enjoy it. 

https://events.democrats.org/event/654680/
I actually just signed up for the text messaging volunteering program for tomorrow and next Wednesday through the DNC üòÄ

Excellent! Here are some more links for onboarding/trainings you can look into. The Vote team info session might be good to attend if you are comfortable using zoom to chat via writing to provide info to others during phone banks or help them with tech related questions (you wouldn‚Äôt actually be making calls). The online engagement trainings are easy and fun, and the DNC special projects at this time might be a good fit for you. 

https://events.democrats.org/event/615101/

https://events.democrats.org/event/670047/

https://events.democrats.org/event/621790/

<@692908285602562110> I just heard from the organizer in the Nashua NH office. They are at 60 Main St and you are welcome to drop in any time to do canvassing! The office is open from 10 AM to 6 PM from Tuesday to Friday in addition to the scheduled weekend events

Hi, Stacy! Sorry I missed your message earlier and I'm so happy you are going to volunteer with the texting campaign. I am going to try phone banking--gulp! Also, my local Dem committee is organizing a postcarding event next week. Maybe your local Dem folks have something similar going on? If you want to DM me, I can tell you more about the postcard writing campaigns I've worked on.
## [Massachuesetts Voter Information](https://www.vote.org/state/massachusetts/)

Hi Carolyn B. My name is Deborah Brunet and I just signed up today. I am just outside of Boston. I would love to help on a postcard writing campaign among other things. My time is flexible.
I am also willing to make phone calls, track simple data and more
I DM'ed you with some info about a postcarding event next week in Watertown.
Here's info on phone banking: https://events.democrats.org/event/664004/

Hi Deborah, would you like to volunteer in person at all in New Hampshire? Or would you prefer to work remotely at home? You may want to look into the Voter Protection program (hotline & poll observation) for New Hampshire---let me know if you want me to link the info here. The voter hotline stuff is all remote at home. Also you can do phone banking from home (see link in previous post above), text banking, or sign up for a training to be a "chat" or "data" captain for the zoom phone banks with the distributed organizing team!
I live in Mass. I could make it into Boston and the surrounding area but not up to NH.
Started a thread.
Thank you, Holly - much thanks
Unfortunately I don't drive. I use a wheelchair but have access to the wheel chair transportation which is affordable.
I will look into what you suggested also

Let me know if you need help locating any of the signup links again! We have text banking from home all day every day, zoom phone banks from home every day, DNC special projects/data entry training weekly, and and VOTE team trainings to help facilitate the zoom phone banks (including chat captain and data/tech captain if you don't want a speaking role)---I believe there is an info session for those roles on Sunday. We are fortunate that there is so much we can do remotely these days!
Ok. Many thanks.
Question: does Massachusetts have a field office open in the Boston area?

Not with the campaign directly, no---they are focused on the battleground states. But MassDems is working with the coordinated campaign in New Hampshire. So if you prefer to volunteer closer to home while still making an impact in a less-blue state than MA, you can sign up for some of the local events here via MassDems or other volunteer groups that are hosting phone banks etc for NH! You can go to events.democrats.org and search for events near you by filtering for location...let me know if you need help

I have the invite set up in Evite and would like to include a URL where people can donate $50 per person to the Harris campaign as their ticket price. Would be ideal to track how much I raise through the ticket sales. Something similar to the pages people can create for Pan Mass challenge or Boston marathon etc fundraising. Does anyone know where and how to set up a personalized fundraising page?

<@1267643778043482122> I‚Äôm actually looking to do something like data entry, in a live setting hopefully.  I can‚Äôt drive to NH but I can get around Boston/North Shore.
Sorry I don't know how to set up a personalized fundraising campaign, but Evite should allow you to include a checkbox that your guests can check when they use the donate link.

Hello! If you scroll up you'll see we've been discussing diff ways to get involved.

Hi! Phone banking is our biggest priority. We do zoom phone banks every day multiple times a day with training and support provided throughout. Would you be willing to give it a try? If not, we also have a robust texting program and there may be a few training slots left. Let me know if you need help finding the links to these online events. If you‚Äôre interested in online engagement they also have multiple virtual events on how to most effectively share information online and also on how to organize your friends and family. Lastly, you could volunteer to be a voter protection hotline volunteer in NH (remote from home). The NH state party has voter protection town halls and trainings virtually. Let me know if any of these are of interest and if you need help finding the links! Many of them are posted on discord daily in the announcements/general thread

Crystal - if you get set up as a bundler you can get a raiser link. But otherwise you cannot track donations. I find that the easiest thing to do is just give people the Act Blue links for the Harris/Walz campaign and then ask them to take a screen shot of the receipt and send it to you as the organizer so you can see the success of the event.

Welcome, Aafyre - the MassDems are prioritizing door knocking and phone banking to NH. 25% of the door knocking volunteers are from MA, and they need us.  The organizers in NH do a great job pairing up people who are new to Door knocking or phone banking with proper training and - in the case of door knocking - having a buddy. I love door knocking it gets me out into the communities and learning about what matters to voters. My advice is if you are going to door knock, find a location that works for you and go there regularly. You get to build a relationshiop with the organizers and get to know the town/city, and build a sense of comfort. 

These are the Volunteer links I have gotten from the MA State Organizer, but you can also go to go.kamalaharris.com and plug in your zip code for priority events:

Manchester: RSVP link https://www.mobilize.us/massdems/event/634549

Hi everyone. I attended an intro meeting on Zoom about different things we can do to help with the campaign and I've decided that postcards are the best fit for me. Does anyone here know where I should go if I'm interested in this? Any specific websited? Thanks üôÇ
Hello! This site is a good compilation of postcard campaigns: https://www.postcardsforamerica.com/gotv-postcards.html
Thanks üôÇ
There's so many options in the first link. Any specific reccomendations on which one is best?

<@211694679870144512>  I think that depends on your time/abilities/interests... Do you have a personal connection to any of the swing states/districts? If so, that may make your efforts more meaningful to you. Some postcard campaigns supply the cards; others don't. Some campaigns supply cards that are mostly written --you add a sentence or two and postage; for others, you have to write the whole message. For the letters, you only add a sentence or two to a template--but you have to print out the letters. Basically, they're all pretty easy to do... but each one is a little different.

Thanks. I don't have any particular connection to any of the swing states. Since this will be my first time volunteering for any political activity, I think it makes sense to try to keep things as simple as possible for now. Any recommendations on places with mostly pre-written scripts and that send you the postcards themselves? If not, I don't mind doing some research to find out for myself. Thanks again üôÇ

This may be exactly what you're looking for.  Pre-written and addresses are on labels. You add a short message and stamps. (Keep in mind, all of these efforts are anonymous.) This campaign is directed at a key district in NE: https://shop.bluewavepostcards.org/

Also, <@211694679870144512> , thank you for getting involved! I started with postcard writing years ago. I predict you're going to feel GREAT b/c you're taking action to affect outcomes. Postcard/letter writing has been well researched and proven to have an impact.
Thanks so much, I'll check it out right now üôÇ
Feel free to DM me if you have any questions <:WalzHappy:1270392508467380339>

It's good to have options and I'd like to point out Common Good's campaign starts you with just 15 postcards and Mom's Rising has a packet of 20 cards, these are great entry level amounts compared to other sites with minimums of 100 or 200 postcards.  https://www.postcardsforamerica.com/gotv-postcards.html

**Strict Fundraising Rules (it‚Äôs the law):**
We can only fundraise on behalf of: Democratic National Committee, Harris Victory Fund or Harris for President directly. 
We can recruit for "non-official events" that are hosted by partner organizations or volunteers in ‚Å†non-official-events-only. We can recruit into anything that is listed on events.democrats.org or a state democratic party's mobilize.
Rule 3 Note > Relevance: Do not post links to petitions or other calls to action that haven‚Äôt been approved by Staff. This forum is not intended for debates. Additionally, do not attempt to raise funds or share fundraising links for any entity besides the Democratic National Committee. Using this server to raise funds for yourself, another candidate, or another organization violates campaign finance law and is strictly prohibited. Anyone who violates the rules is subject to removal or time out.
When in doubt, ask @Community Moderator.

Spent the day door knocking in Windham / Salem, NH today. Some observations: 

- We are still in voter identity time. This means we are looking for people have been voters in the past and who were unaffiliated, or who have voted Democrat in the past, but may not be diehard Dems. This is very common in NH. 
- There were a lot of voters who were undecided. Speaking to voters is very important. Marile was great at talking about Project 2025, I pushed that VP Harris was in New Hampshire last week speaking about her Economic Plan and the local news have done a great deal of coverage of the event. (Thankfully, NH has a lot of very active local newspapers). 
- Yes, there were some Tr-mp supporters (mostly men) who answered the door and wouldn't give the wives space to speak. There were also men who just didn't answer the door, despite us seeing them inside. Yes, I would rather speak to the obnoxious Tr-mp voter who literally shouted at us. At least he told me who he was. He didn't intimidate me, and frankly, he looked very small next to his big truck. 
- Favorite homes? The small family farmer whose 4 people in the household would be supporting Kamala Harris ... I picked up some local honey from her farm stand. And the woman who had just come home from a vacation in the Poconos and was thrilled to see me with my Kamala Harris and NH Democrats literature. "Thank goodness you are here!" 
- It felt great to walk and knock. We need more door knockers. We are going to be finishing Voter ID time and moving into persuasion time soon. And we need YOU to knock knock knock.

did my first phone bank  today- (SC) lots of hang ups from angry Trumpers. 
Harris really needs to hammer out a strong border policy if you have a shot of turning red to blue. They an angry group.  Also, she needs to expand her economic policy beyond ‚Äú $50,000 for new businesses and building homes.‚Äù  not everyone plans to build a new business. I had one woman say she‚Äôs most concerned about the performance of her 401(k) if Democrats win.   we need to get the message out that Harris‚Äôs  economic Plan will be far better for the economy than Trumps.

Thanks for sharing your experience. Did you also post in the <#1242256751445934262> channel? It will be beneficial for the team to have as part of their debrief process. Thanks for doing this important work.
Next time they mention their 401k point out how amazing the stock market has done under Biden. Their 401k must‚Äôve grown pretty big the last 4 years

<@1284546135574446207> all of this is essential for the debrief form we share at the end of each phone bank session. If you need the link, lmk and I can DM it to you. 
I will also say that the phone bank sessions into swing states are the most challenging, but also the most essential. Each time you have an angry MAGA supporter on the end of the line, remind yourself that you are culling them from our calls lists now so that, come November, when we are vigilantly calling all Harris supporters and undecided voters to GOTV, we are an efficient, well-oiled machine that will drive us to victory on election night. You are pulling the weeds for our beautiful future garden. 

If that doesn't work, I suggest taking a 10 minute break to watch YouTube videos of baby goats wearing pajamas. 
https://youtu.be/RSxuuY90_Uw?si=vd4CasUXxOUqBrsj

You are welcome. 

But seriously, thank you for making calls and sticking with it. We absolutely need everyone doing this work. You're a rockstar.
I'll be joining https://www.mobilize.us/indivisiblegreaterandover/ on 3 different dates to write postcards to various battleground states. If anyone is interested in the Middlesex/Essex county area.
